intro: Tragia frieseana, commonly known as the Friesean tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with a hairy texture, and it thrives in dry, arid environments. Tragia frieseana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
